medical_history.chief_complaint: Constitutional growth delay and familial short stature.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Decreased linear growth was noticed at age 6 years. The patient was first evaluated at age 8.5 years when his height was 115 cm. Over the following 5 years, his mean growth velocity was 3.5 cm/yr, leading to a height of 132.8 cm at age 13.5 years. Following testosterone treatment at age 14 years, his growth velocity increased to 6 cm/yr, with no further development observed in the following year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral cryptorchidism, surgically corrected through orchidopexy at age 4 years.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are first-degree cousins with short stature. Father's height is 160 cm and mother's height is 150 cm.
